meanings.definition: To sell (something) before it is available for purchase.
meanings.sent1: The store presells the new video game to eager customers.
meanings.sent2: The company presells concert tickets to ensure a full house on the day of the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician presells tickets to his disappearing act, making people wonder if they will vanish too.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent presells the dream home, painting a picture of a perfect life for potential buyers.
meanings.sent5: The author presells copies of her upcoming book, building anticipation among her readers.

meanings.definition: To promote or advertise (something) in advance of its release.
meanings.sent1: The movie studio presells the blockbuster film with exciting trailers and posters.
meanings.sent2: The company presells the new product through social media campaigns and email newsletters.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant presells its special dish, creating a buzz among food enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The fashion brand presells its latest collection, captivating fashionistas with sneak peeks.
meanings.sent5: The tech company presells the innovative gadget, teasing its features to tech enthusiasts.
